Definition.WordDefinition: APPLAUSE, n. The echo of a platitude.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Applause \Ap*plause"\, n. [L. applaudere, applausum. See {Applaud}.] The act of applauding; approbation and praise publicly expressed by clapping the hands, stamping or tapping with the feet, acclamation, huzzas, or other means; marked commendation. [1913 Webster]
The brave man seeks not popular applause. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Acclaim; acclamation; plaudit; commendation; approval. [1913 Webster]
applause n : a demonstration of approval by clapping the hands together [syn: {hand clapping}, {clapping}]
